question: What martial art does Pom Klementieff practice, in which she holds a purple belt?

content: Question: What martial art does Pom Klementieff practice, in which she holds a purple belt?

<python>
results = search_pages("Pom Klementieff martial art")
if results:
    page_id = results[0]['page_id']
    sections = view_sections(page_id)
    for section in sections:
        content = read_section(section['section_id'])
        if "martial art" in content.lower() or "belt" in content.lower():
            print(content)
            break
</python>

<python_output>
### 2013–present: Breakthrough

Klementieff made her Hollywood debut in [Lee](Spike)(Spike Lee)'s *[Oldboy](Oldboy (2013 film))* (2013), a remake of the South Korean [of the same name](film)(Oldboy (2003 film)). She portrayed Haeng-bok, the bodyguard of the antagonist played by [Copley](Sharlto)(Sharlto Copley). A fan of the original film, Klementieff heard about the part through [Lee](Roy)(Roy Lee), a producer with the remake, and took boxing lessons after learning the role involved martial arts. After showcasing her boxing skills during her audition, Lee asked her to go home and come back wearing a more feminine outfit and make-up, like her character in the film. She contributed some of her own clothes to the character's wardrobe, and trained three hours a day for two months for an on-screen fight with star [Brolin](Josh)(Josh Brolin). Klementieff came up with the name Haeng-bok, Korean for "happiness", herself after Lee asked her to research possible names for the character.

Klementieff moved to Los Angeles after *Oldboy* was filmed and began pursuing more Hollywood auditions. She continued [taekwondo](taekwondo) after the film, and has a purple belt as of the summer of 2014. Her next acting role was the film ''Hacker's Game* (2015), in which she plays a hacker she compared to [Salander](Lisbeth)(Lisbeth Salander) from the novel *[Girl with the Dragon Tattoo](The)(The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo)''. Klementieff used her boxing skills again in the film, and due to the movie's low budget, she had to do her own make-up and choose her own wardrobe. It was her idea to dye her hair purple for the role, to which the directors first objected but later acquiesced. In 2017, she appeared in the romance drama *[Newness](Newness)* and the black comedy-drama *[Goes West](Ingrid)(Ingrid Goes West)*.

Klementieff received worldwide recognition when she joined the [Cinematic Universe](Marvel)(Marvel Cinematic Universe) as [Mantis](Mantis (Marvel Comics)), appearing in the films *[of the Galaxy Vol. 2](Guardians)(Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2)* (2017), *[Infinity War](Avengers:)(Avengers: Infinity War)* (2018), and *[Endgame](Avengers:)(Avengers: Endgame)* (2019). In 2019, she appeared in an episode of the [Netflix](Netflix) science fiction anthology series *[Mirror](Black)(Black Mirror)*, the thriller film *[Gems](Uncut)(Uncut Gems)*, and had voice roles in the animated supernatural comedy film *[Addams Family](The)(The Addams Family (2019 film))*. In 2020, she had a recurring role as Martel in the [HBO](HBO) science fiction series *[Westworld](Westworld (TV series))*. She reprised her role as Mantis in the 2023 sequel *[of the Galaxy Vol. 3](Guardians)(Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3)*, as well as appearing in the upcoming *[Impossible – Dead Reckoning Part One](Mission:)(Mission: Impossible – Dead Reckoning Part One)* and *[Impossible – Dead Reckoning Part Two](Mission:)(Mission: Impossible – Dead Reckoning Part Two)* in 2023 and 2024, respectively.


</python_output>
